text: Shavei Darom (, lit. Returnees to the South) is a village in southern Israel. Located to the south-east of Sderot, it falls under the jurisdiction of Merhavim Regional Council. In it had a population of . ==History== The village was built to rehouse former residents of Kfar Darom, an Israeli settlement in the Gaza Strip that was evacuated as part of the Gaza disengagement in 2005. Its construction was approved by the government in December 2009, with the former settlers having lived in Ashkelon following their removal from Gaza.New Town for Gush Katif Evacuees Israel National News, 27 December 2009 The new residents arrived in 2010, initially living in caravans.Our Story Shavei Darom ==References== ==External links== *Official website Category:Populated places established in 2010 Category:2010 establishments in Israel Category:Populated places in Southern District (Israel)
title: Shavei Darom
